title: Ways to tone down Yasuo before you inevitably rework him
body:
1. Make it more difficult to build up his passive shield than just walking around lane.  When you call CotC cancer for lane because it lessens trades but Yasuo exists and can block a solid chunk of his opponents damage every minion wave is just absurd.  He should actually have to interact in order to build his shield rather than just run around while its down.

2. Get rid of 2 mechanics that he really doesn't need:  
           A. The ult mechanic that places him as far away from a tower as possible so that he won't be hit by the tower while having the animation go off. 
           B. How his wind wall spawns slightly behind him and pushes itself in the cast direction, so that it blocks projectiles that have literally already hit Yasuo.   Also, his wind wall blocks projectiles from all angles, even behind.  It should only block projectiles from the direction it is cast to, in the same way that braum shield works.  So that he can't pull the dodging from 1 side of the wall to the other and negating all ranged damage for 4 seconds.

3.  Make his free double crit passive scale with levels as you have done with literally every other champ in the game.  So he gets 10-100% increased critical strike chance based on champ level, scaling from 1 to 18.

All of these would help reduce Yasuos early game dominance, since he is currently an early game monster with one of the best late-games in the whole game

replies.body: These are solid suggestions.

I like 1 and 2 but his crit passive needs to stay the same. It's the only thing stopping people from building him as a complete bruiser. Also if they did make it so his crit chance scaled they would have to buff his ultimate.

I feel like the problem with{{champion:157}} is that he is too safe. When you think of a high risk-high reward champion Yasuo should be one of the first to come up. Right now he can access a lot of the reward while also staying safe. I think that his base stats play a part in this. His base stats are actually **really** low for a melee champion so Riot gave him his shield and wall to compensate for that. A lot of people suggest nerfs while forgetting this.

He has no scaling MR so he relies on his dashes and shields to defend himself vs mages.

I may be wrong but I'm fairly certain that Yasuo's base stats were hit by nerfs over time. So saying that he was given the shield and wall to compensate that wouldn't be quite right. his base stats have slowly been taking hits due to the massive amount of defensive power in his windwall and passive shield.

Personally I think the shield should simply be removed with compensation added elsewhere in his kit, even if it ended up being something like a parry at the beginning of windwall, slight buffs to his hp/5 or other base stats, or lowering windwall cooldown.

4) Atm, Yasuo has an alternate resource, flow, which only functions with a single part of his kit, the passive. Seems out of place how no other abilities interact with it. Make windwall consume flow, increasing in duration per flow consumed.

His E generates a fixed amount of flow, since it causes him to move, and his W **used** to passively increase the amount of flow his E gave him, but that got nerfed ages ago for being too strong. It's kind of a shame, actually, because that passive made it so that each of his abilities interacted directly with another, and that's some elegant design, yo.

Yasuo's "strong early game" is one of the biggest myths of all time. Yasuo has a strong lvl 1 against melee champs and a strong lvl 2 against most champs. His levels 3-13 are garbage and his lvl 6 is especially bad against real duelists; his first back is also among the weakest of all solo laners. Don't get dumpstered in the first 5 minutes and you'll start beating Yasuo with most champs. And if you get ahead of Yasuo, you're going to stay ahead on most champs unless you get massively outplayed.
